thread.title: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this month
thread.title_full: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this month | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: palmbeachpost
title: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this month
text:
1. Fort Myers area
Island Hopper Songwriter Fest. Thursday through Sept. 27: Captiva, Thursday through Sunday; historic downtown Fort Myers, Sept. 21-24; Fort Myers Beach, Sept. 25-27. Usually, behind every great country-music hit is another singer/songwriter who wrote the tune. This event features some of the best, including Jana Kramer, Kristian Bush and Whiskey Rose. Learn the back-stories behind country’s biggest hits by artists such as Garth Brooks, Brad Paisley and Lee Ann Womack. fortmyers-sanibel.com/island-hopper
The Perdido Key Pirate Festival is set for Saturday. CONTRIBUTED 2. Perdido Key
Perdido Key Pirate Festival. Saturday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., Big Lagoon State Park. Gather yer crew ’n’ set sail for an island adventure for pirates of all ages. Event includes live music, pirate games, storytelling, a live reptile show, food vendors, arts and crafts, and a hunt for buried treasure. Prizes include condominium stays, personal-watercraft rentals, an island-hopping tour and dining gift certificates. Admission to the festival is included with $6 park entrance fee. 12301 Gulf Beach Highway. 800-328-0107; www.visitperdido.com/events/pirate-fest-2015
3. Altha
Swamp and Stomp Mud Run V. Saturday, Altha Recreation Park. Registration begins 7 a.m.; full-course Mud Run starts 8 a.m. This 5K-ish run features rolling farmlands and gorgeous North Florida scenery, with tree-lined trails and sun-drenched fields. But the highlight is the Calhoun County Mud Pit. This “off-road adventure” is down-and-dirty but fun, and features obstacles such as hay bales and climbing walls. (Afterward, there are rinse stations, and bags are provided for mud-stained clothes.) $15-$40. 15471 NW Bodiford Road. www.active.com/altha-fl/running/mud-runs-races/swamp-and-stomp-mud-run-v-2015
